name: Chicken with Morels and a Sherry Sauce
recipeIngredient: 50 ml of dry white wine or sherry (boiled for 30 seconds to reduce the alcohol,
recipeInstructions: 1. Soak the morels in 125 ml of water (ideally overnight).
2. Drain the morels, reserving the juice, sieve to remove any grit, squeezing the mushrooms dry. Rinse the mushrooms to remove any grit. Chop the roughly.
3. Season the chicken breasts and Brown in butter over a medium heat for 3 minutes per side. Remove from the pan.

4. Add the morel and button  mushrooms to the pan with a pinch of salt and soften for 2 minutes. Add the boiled wine or sherry and the mushroom juice and double cream. Bring to the boil and add the chicken breasts. Reduce the heat to a bare simmer and cook for 7 minutes.
5. Remove the chicken breasts and keep warm. Increase the heat, and boil down the sauce until it coats the back of a spoon. Season.
6. Boil the chopped leaks in 100ml of water with the butter and salt with the lid on for 3 minutes.
7. Return the chicken breasts to the sauce, warm through, then serve over the leeks.
